thread.title: Man kills self after chopping off wife's arm
thread.title_full: Man kills self after chopping off wife's arm

title: Man kills self after chopping off wife's arm
text:
Man kills self after chopping off wife's arm By John Unson (philstar.com) | Updated March 11, 2017 - 5:14pm The man committed suicide after chopping off his wife's arm and wounding two of his relatives who tried to pacify him. Philstar.com/File photo 
MAGUINDANAO, Philippines - A jobless man on Friday chopped off his wife’s arm with a machete and hanged himself dead after the hacking frenzy in Datu Odin Sinsuat town. 
Chief Inspector Achmad Alibonga of the Datu Odin Sinsuat municipal police said responding policemen tried but failed to revive the 31-year-old Landy Paulino, who hanged himself from a tree in their yard using a nylon rope. 
Alibonga said Paulino has been restive after his wife, Lenny, an overseas worker, arrived on Monday and has since been urging him persistently to account for all the money she remitted from abroad. 
Their neighbors in Barangay Awang in Datu Odin Sinsuat said the couple repeatedly quarreled over monetary issues early on. 
“The suspect could not explain to his wife where he spent the money sent to him monthly in the past two years,” Alibonga said. 
On Friday, Paulino arrived home so drunk, pulled out a sharp machete hidden in their kitchen and hacked the left arm of his wife. Nation ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 
“The victim’s arm was cut in one stroke,” Alibonga said. 
Paulino immediately went out of their house, while a commotion in the neighborhood ensued, and committed suicide after wounding two of his relatives who tried to pacify him. 
“We are certain he had planned to hang himself from a tree near their house because there was a rope there dangling before the incident,” Alibonga said. Nation ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1
